document.title: CTE Career Pathways and Programs of Study

16235AB2333A45A9846C2DF2B53E8F32.description:
Apply principles and elements of effective instruction and assessment in the field experience
setting.

B7BDEB4F68F74AA7A17007639A6F1357.description:
Plan a community/and or family school partnership event to positively influence the school
environment

13D4514DE269440EB9590304524CCC47.description:
Design a plan for materials, furnishings, and other resources to create safe and effective
instructional environments.

D8FF6133518C42D7B2BB60F41C8B465B.description: Examine the value of using bibliotherapy in the classroom.

5D01861788E443479BDCFE5EA0B3610C.description:
Construct and implement an integrated (interdisciplinary) lesson plan using children’s
literature based on the Indiana academic standards.

C3883B9AC9614945BF62DAA62A32E9B1.description: Construct and implement a literacy lesson plan based on the Indiana academic standards.

BE57FD8A497342CDB727C03ED202F081.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of the importance of children’s literature as it reflects the
social, cognitive, and emotional development of children.

461D5628811B4C4F9492607D1D357690.description:
Compare and contrast various narrative elements in children’s literature: plot, characters,
setting, and conflict.

466A109A8FE04968A8EBFFB59A48BF99.description: Examine the value of rhythm and rhyme in children’s literature.

4B5B201BB4A34E8FAB86CCE168B59D9E.description: Compare and contrast various children’s authors and illustrators.

4AF3FAEBC75B422C98ED5B29C1301E26.description:
Evaluate and select quality pieces of literature including books receiving the Newbery Award
and Caldecott Medal distinctions for future use in a classroom.

6075C2550DCE46DF9FD73B53461E0BD5.description:
Explore and practice effective teaching strategies for the use of children’s literature in the
classroom.

CAC252855E214E8BADFA681A0C606E27.description:
Express the benefits of reading aloud, of being read to, and reading silently. Explore methods
to teach effective listening skills.

EB2308FB2C264E9D9CD091AFBEAC6B6F.description: Describe the process of literacy development in the young child.

CAA4F6AF28304E92A3DF9F7BC0BB94DE.description:
Discuss the use of children’s literature to develop phonological awareness, phonemic
awareness, fluency skills, comprehension skills, and vocabulary.

A32B8A5D842C4FA4AEA8D192322F763E.description: Domain: Developing Literacy through Children's Literature

FAD33586803343B39E505E91ACBCBF22.description: Describe and explain the various roles and responsibilities of the special education teacher.

B18D2D44CFA74924B1CB9769C0A62C96.description: Develop techniques to collaborate with other professionals and parents regarding children with special needs.

BDF064B004AD4208B6E2C897C2A4A5E4.description: Describe the main goals of early intervention.

B6190A2600C54264B3DF40C8641DF1FD.description: Determine and write instructional goals for children with special needs.

E7D28BDEC7B34204B7A5917A489B895F.description:
Create adaptive materials to use with children enrolled in special education, including gifted/
talented programs.

00833A926D9D40CCB35FDBFADA220D07.description:
Design classroom environments to meet the needs of all children. Evaluate school playgrounds
for accessibility.

66DAC52457B94E0CA655D30BA393CB7E.description: Develop techniques to work with the exceptional child and support inclusion in the typical classroom setting.

4DF896F4DA7D4FF296D64062ED52DDA6.description:
Explain the IFSP (Individual Family Service Plan) and the IEP (Individual Education Program)
processes and the requirements of each.

AB98BD21193347718D6E99155DC7B6DC.description: Define the aspects of the family/teacher community partnership.

E0B2BBEEE2DC464EBE2ECABA40D58B98.description:
Research various types of disabilities and the developmental and health characteristics
associated with them.

ECA68D6C7FD644EDA2E81DE81C6F28D6.description:
Identify developmental likenesses and differences in children, both those who are typically
developing and those with special needs.

45A83187DFCC4D5EA26C20AE28878BA9.description:
Explain the term LRE (Least Restrictive Environment) and how this influences the services
provided to school-age children with disabilities.

1DDB5BCD978E485E8900883D16A12A72.description:
Identify and define the categories of disabilities and eligibility criteria as stipulated in federal
(IDEA) and State (Article 7) legislation.

142C3EE3CE1C4615A717602AB6563598.description:
Describe society’s changing attitudes towards exceptional children and their families, including
the influence of the media, public policy, and laws pertaining to special education.

7EBB14085B4542CE953F71BEF3471C4C.description: Analyze and utilize the standards presented in the NETS and InNTASC consortia.

6AAC2BEB8A2E4CB3962BE2897613DD15.description: Explore the availability and use of assistive technologies for students with special needs.

6154D3131F36490685B5DAC5260A113C.description:
Analyze the social, ethical, legal, and human issues surrounding the use of technology in the
classroom.

1656744F88534705BE2F7EAFD6D9162E.description: Use technology to enhance the teacher’s productivity, efficiency, and professional practice.

D9E32DD658EE4B9FAB2316A3B33118C4.description: Apply technology to the creation of effective assessment and evaluation strategies.

0B2567386710466396AD56296E4CBE72.description:
Apply current research on teaching and learning with technology to the planning of
appropriate and challenging instructional materials and learning environments.

ABCA50891ECF4FEA9A84429CB2BCD3BF.description: Plan and design effective learning environments and experiences supported by technology.

D0B5565434804D0F92108EAB1E9D96A3.description: Demonstrate an understanding of technological operations and concepts for instruction.

76147FF6E0B34867987F97CB00525FC5.description: Create instructional materials in a variety of applications, formats, and styles.

E83DBF16D9B8496EA1993ACA0D079477.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of the role and responsibilities of the general educator in
monitoring learner progress and collecting data from formal and informal assessments to inform instruction.

BE174CD8E68F41AE9A4C908FD901C783.description: Evaluate student data to guide instruction.

36CB007333174AC0A2EA3E1600F8195D.description: Create schedules, activities, routines, and transitions that promote learning.

CBBC4CB72817409AA9D1F59AA9265DAE.description:
Demonstrate discussion and questioning techniques that promote critical thinking and
problem solving.

C297412D6CE14921B574F96C5E6DF1F4.description:
Determine management strategies that promote positive student behavior while engaging
students in learning.

606D751515F24BFD91CDA3D16E2AC1E7.description:
Discuss effective instructional frameworks and methods such as differentiated instruction,
cooperative learning, project-based learning, and metacognitive strategies.

8DAC2F443A214DD393F6DB8DCDAA9912.description: Identify classroom management strategies for the elementary and secondary classroom.

1E54A3AADA4A4ADC81B7342139D9B80E.description: Establish instructional goals that are developmentally appropriate.

18EA2E9884B84430B074D2AD455C97A3.description: Identify community and school resources needed to support children and families from birth through adolescence.

B65F6C80977F426390C7DC9DDC7003F2.description: Identify and explore ways to support diverse children/adolescents in their personal growth and development related to trust, autonomy, initiative, industry, and identity (Erikson's stages).

2EA0D15F55B140AAB6CC3907E1E1B8D3.description: Identify and analyze societal issues facing today's children/adolescents, including students with exceptional needs.

9D05C1BA719D4B2481D0DC7A53ED8952.description: Recognize appropriate personal strengths and behaviors (dispositions) for adults working with school-aged children.

8E0F0DC2744645359713A0485052A360.description: Identify environments that promote healthy social/emotional development for all children/adolescents.

D1E9302F0C9C4FD1B72C87EB1EDB247E.description: Identify prosocial and antisocial behavior.  Discuss culturally appropriate behavior management techniques.

60AF4449E2924C7ABE66F7B6A885F203.description: Discuss confidentiality when working with children/adolescents and families.

967B0D3CFCE74DE09AA5B0F5647726B5.description: Examine and implement observation and interviewing skills as a means of understanding the child

C0C83F8B402D46D7A80230BF2EBF6C2A.description: Recognize theories of growth and development that focus on early and middle childhood through the adolescent years

2370DF42B4414AF3988FFFBBB552214C.description: Explore the physical, social, emotional, cognitive, and moral development of the child from birth through adolescence

7FAF949999094B04BBDA32F15C44D62A.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of appropriate instructional materials and methods for learners with high and low incidence disabilities and the accommodations that can be made
for them in inclusive settings.

89AC5A671ED44593990558227556444D.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of differentiated instruction and heterogeneous grouping to
meet the needs of diverse learners.

B7485F3C09EF43CDA30528043BD6FC93.description: Explain the significance of the research and rationale for inclusive education.

67B9E888BB414BE79F03A2D2AA86F2D1.description: Analyze relevant standards in instructional planning and assessment.

3940BCB9F77F4841BB4FBFD6F469DE10.description:
Differentiate between various types of assessments including formative, summative,
traditional, and authentic.

F7FA7EAC3881406AAA0AE5B5E496FCC1.description: Assess the structure of school governance

738304CFE7F3496A9F8C6594D8FB4045.description: Examine ways student learning is influenced by teaching strategies.

E921B348C4734797B73BCD33FEFC346A.description: Explain how schedules, activities, routines, and transitions promote learning

30BFC355B1774AD49656F0FF8DC90C7A.description: Complete a minimum of twenty (20) hours of supervised service learning/field work experience in a classroom and reflect on the experience in relation to personal skills, dispositions, and future professional decisions.

407C4C802D044FF1B40F1499D0A1F6CB.description: Identify and observe in the classroom the cultural, family, and environmental factors that affect students in schools.

DFF2A32E98CA4ABCBA071131D70BFB80.description: Recognize and examine the diversity in schools in the United States and globally.

3753915B9FCD44FAB0A20D545B0F9A7E.description: Identify and observe in the classroom various elements of diversity that affect K-12 student learning and accomplishment.

67EA1FFCD22247A992245C3F374DC0A2.description: Review the history of American education and identify the philosophical foundations of education and their global roots.

18C785CD5F0646E8BDC97925EAA194C6.description: Define and describe the nature, purpose, and responsibilities of the public education system in a democratic society. Compare and contrast with the role of public education in other countries.

A02340AC6A434E4095FCBCD7569A9A9B.description:
Identify career choices within the field of education, including opportunities to teach abroad.
Explore programs for professional preparation.

CAA9D27C6D5E43F081159319EBFAAF00.description:
Recognize and identify strategies to support the family’s role as the child’s first teacher and to
support the family/teacher partnership in a culturally competent manner.

FAA213DDDA584132B56BD6CCF7C6CB11.description:
Review current teacher licensure laws in the State of Indiana. Compare this licensure process
with requirements for teaching in a variety of global locations.

7CDDD7D16FE1463B81AC60789C9D201A.description:
Reflect on personal reasons for entering the teaching profession and write an initial statement
of educational philosophy.

171577377D0246C48043E7D932AE88D0.description: Recognize the essential function of professional ethics, personal morals, and a strong value system in the role of the teacher, including the importance of confidentiality and liability issues pertaining to family/school relationships.

16E9F220F33B4A1885E15E4D6B2B8697.description: Define and evaluate his/her own teaching dispositions and learning style.

8C2916C75CC4426AB0F62F536386DEEC.description: Identify and appreciate the essential qualifications and personal demands of teaching as a profession.
